description: From Latin ex (“out”) + carnificatus, past participle carnificare (“to carnify”). Compare Latin excarnificare (“to tear to pieces, torment”). See carnify.

verbs.description: excarnificate (third-person singular simple present excarnificates, present participle excarnificating, simple past and past participle excarnificated)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To strip (something) of flesh; to excarnate.
